snippet.title: Terror T.R.A.X.: Track of the Vampire (1995) PC Playthrough - NintendoComplete
snippet.description:
A beginning to end playthrough of Grolier Interactive's 1995 Windows 3.1 interactive movie, Terror T.R.A.X.: Track of the Vampire. This recording was captured from an S-Video feed off of a Pentium 200mhz MMX running Windows 3.11. This was not done in DosBox nor any virtual machines.

Terror TRAX, a vampire themed FMV PC game, is one of the more entertaining (barely interactive) interactive movies to come out of the mid 1990s. Featuring lots of CG, questionable makeup, and a shaky handicam viewpoint that would make Blair Witch jealous, Officers Graves and Walkin have to hunt down a vampire and a succubus after responding to some X-Files style 911 phone calls. The plot is pretty stupid, involving a vampire  that runs a dating agency and an executed death-row inmate who has come back from the dead looking for his organs that were donated to people in need, but it makes for an enjoyable short-lived romp. It's no worse than Night Trap, but that doesn't really mean too much. 

Detective Graves is pretty damned hilarious, I have to admit, especially when noting the lack of "road pizza" after someone flings themselves out of a window, or when referring to a smoldering ashtray as "Sizzlin' Cs". I mean, come on! Who in the hell wrote this?!

The gameplay is incredibly simple: every so often a choice needs to be made, prompting the player to hit either A or B. That's about it. Hope you enjoy watching it!
___________________________
No cheats were used during the recording of this video.
